member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryContext
member.summary: Used as a per request state.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryOptions
member.summary: Provides programmatic configuration for the antiforgery token system.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryOptions.CookieName
member.summary: Specifies the name of the cookie that is used by the antiforgery system.
member.remarks: If an explicit name is not provided, the system will automatically generate a name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryOptions.FormFieldName
member.summary: Specifies the name of the antiforgery token field that is used by the antiforgery system.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryOptions.HeaderName
member.summary: Specifies the name of the header value that is used by the antiforgery system. If null then antiforgery validation will only consider form data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryOptions.RequireSsl
member.summary: Specifies whether SSL is required for the antiforgery system to operate. If this setting is 'true' and a non-SSL request comes into the system, all antiforgery APIs will fail.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryOptions.SuppressXFrameOptionsHeader
member.summary: Specifies whether to suppress the generation of X-Frame-Options header which is used to prevent ClickJacking. By default, the X-Frame-Options header is generated with the value SAMEORIGIN. If this setting is 'true', the X-Frame-Options header will not be generated for the response.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryTokenSet
member.summary: The antiforgery token pair (cookie and request token) for a request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryTokenSet.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates the antiforgery token pair (cookie and request token) for a request.
member.param: The token that is supplied in the request.
The token that is supplied in the request cookie.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryTokenSet.RequestToken
member.summary: The token that is supplied in the request.

members.member: The cookie token is allowed to be null. This would be the case when the old cookie token is still valid. In such cases a call to GetTokens would return a token set with null cookie token.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.DefaultAntiforgery
member.summary: Provides access to the antiforgery system, which provides protection against Cross-site Request Forgery (XSRF, also called CSRF) attacks.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.DefaultAntiforgeryAdditionalDataProvider
member.summary: A default implementation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.DefaultClaimUidExtractor
member.summary: Default implementation of .

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.IAntiforgery
member.summary: Provides access to the antiforgery system, which provides protection against Cross-site Request Forgery (XSRF, also called CSRF) attacks.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.IAntiforgery.GetHtml(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HttpContext)
member.summary: Generates an <input type="hidden"> element for an antiforgery token.
member.param: The associated with the current request.
member.returns: A containing an <input type="hidden"> element. This element should be put inside a <form>.
member.remarks: This method has a side effect: A response cookie is set if there is no valid cookie associated with the request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.IAntiforgery.GetAndStoreTokens(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HttpContext)
member.summary: Generates an for this request and stores the cookie token in the response.
member.param: The associated with the current request.
member.returns: An with tokens for the response.
member.remarks: This method has a side effect: A response cookie is set if there is no valid cookie associated with the request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.IAntiforgery.GetTokens(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HttpContext)
member.summary: Generates an for this request.
member.param: The associated with the current request.
member.remarks: Unlike , this method has no side effect. The caller is responsible for setting the response cookie and injecting the returned form token as appropriate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.IAntiforgery.ValidateRequestAsync(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HttpContext)
member.summary: Validates an antiforgery token that was supplied as part of the request.
member.param: The associated with the current request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.IAntiforgery.ValidateTokens(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HttpContext,Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.AntiforgeryTokenSet)
member.summary: Validates an for the current request.
member.param: The associated with the current request.
The (cookie and request token) for this request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.IAntiforgery.SetCookieTokenAndHeader(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HttpContext)
member.summary: Generates and stores an antiforgery cookie token if one is not available or not valid.
member.param: The associated with the current request.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.IAntiforgeryAdditionalDataProvider
member.summary: Allows providing or validating additional custom data for antiforgery tokens. For example, the developer could use this to supply a nonce when the token is generated, then he could validate the nonce when the token is validated.
member.remarks: The antiforgery system already embeds the client's username within the generated tokens. This interface provides and consumes supplemental data. If an incoming antiforgery token contains supplemental data but no additional data provider is configured, the supplemental data will not be validated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.IAntiforgeryAdditionalDataProvider.GetAdditionalData(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HttpContext)
member.summary: Provides additional data to be stored for the antiforgery tokens generated during this request.
member.returns: Supplemental data to embed within the antiforgery token.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.IAntiforgeryAdditionalDataProvider.ValidateAdditionalData(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HttpContext,System.String)
member.summary: Validates additional data that was embedded inside an incoming antiforgery token.
member.param: Supplemental data that was embedded within the token.
member.returns: True if the data is valid; false if the data is invalid.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.IAntiforgeryTokenGenerator
member.summary: Generates and validates antiforgery tokens.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.IAntiforgeryTokenStore.GetRequestTokensAsync(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HttpContext)
member.summary: Gets the cookie and request tokens from the request. Will throw an exception if either token is not present.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Antiforgery.Resources.AntiforgeryTokenValidator_AuthenticatedUserWithoutUsername
member.summary: The provided identity of type '{0}' is marked {1} = {2} but does not have a value for {3}. By default, the antiforgery system requires that all authenticated identities have a unique {3}. If it is not possible to provide a unique {3} for this identity, consider extending {4} by overriding the {5} or a custom type that can provide some form of unique identifier for the current user.
